title: Does anyone have any good GIF making programs?
content:
I'm looking for good GIF making programs...

(don't worry if my IP changed- I finally have internet acceess on my computor!)

I will not be interested in it if

1. It's hard to use
2. You must pay for it to get all the features or avoid the time limet before you must buy it
3. If it's hard to make the background transparent
4. If it makes you this mad: [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-furious.gif[/img]
5. If it's hard to install and/or setup.

I would preffer it if

1. It's windows only
2. It makes you this happy: [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]
3. It's freeware
4. It has cool featues
5. Easy to make the background transparent

(note: I have 2 ways of making GIFs, both of which are horrible: GameMaker ([img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-furious.gif[/img] ) And Easy GIF Maker ([img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sick.gif[/img] ). Game maker barely has enough abilities (no transparent backrounds, hard to control the rate of each frame, and oh, so much more.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-furious.gif[/img] ), and Easy GIF Maker just... Stinks...[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-barf.gif[/img] )Signed, Harvey Smith
A proud member of the beta testing society
"I help entertain!" -Harvey
Tough guys have no table manners![img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopefish.gif[/img]

title: Re: Does anyone have any good GIF making programs?
content:
Microsoft GIF Animator is pretty easy to use, and it's pretty easy to add transparency and the like, but it has a pretty basic array of features, and in some cases adding transparency will screw up the previous frames. Although, you could always use it in conjunction with [url=http://gifworks.com/image_editor.html]GIFWorks[/url], which DOES have a bunch of nifty features, including transparency, but doesn't actually let you assemble GIFs.

Of course, it sounds like GIFWorks is really all you need.[center]TOUGH GUYS DON'T FOLLOW FADS[/center]

title: Re: Does anyone have any good GIF making programs?
content:
Personnally, I use paint shop pro 6, but I'm not sure if it clashes with one of your criteria...

Real simple- hit anim.exe, and run the animation wizard [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] .

And yes, it seems like gifworks is pretty good too[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] .

[img]http://i16.photobucket.com/albums/b33/freeyorp101/sig2.png[/img]

[hr]

The yorp shalt inherit the mars

title: Re: Does anyone have any good GIF making programs?
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]1. It's windows only[hr][/quote]
Why do you keep throwing this one in? It's by far the most bizarre preference I've ever seen. Did you word it wrong, or are you actually asking for software which is only available for Windows?

I use The GIMP for all my raster editing needs.________________

title: well. almost it
content: Swish max lets you make .swf but you want .gif

title: Re: well. almost it
content:
To install The GIMP on Windows you just install GTK+ and then The GIMP. It's not hard at all. Of course, all I had to do was start my package manager and select The GIMP for installation, but it's not much harder for those of you using difficult operating systems.________________
